intro: Polygala cuneata f. typica, commonly known as the narrow-leaved milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features slender, upright stems with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and naturalized areas.
